text:
After an automated tomcat restart, a debug assertion occured with this message:

The following is from the event log (win 2003 machine, I hope the german text
parts don't cause problems):
Ereignistyp:	Informationen
Ereignisquelle:	Application Popup
Ereigniskategorie:	Keine
Ereigniskennung:	26
Datum:		09.10.2005
Zeit:		03:01:15
Benutzer:		Nicht zutreffend
Computer:	HG-JAVACITY
Beschreibung:
Anwendungspopup: Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime Library: Assertion failed!

Program: ...gramme\Apache Group\Tomcat 5.0\bin\tomcat5.exe
File: ../../../src/share/native/common/check_code.c
Line: 637
Expression: bucket->loadable == JNI_TRUE


The  tomcat was installed from "jakarta-tomcat-5.0.27.exe" and runs as service
(the service was not created by the installer but by making a call to
"bin\service.bat" after installation). It runs under a restricted user account
(only write access to required dirs, such as log files or temp dir).
An Apache 2.0.52 is used, Tomcat and Apache are connected by MOD_JK2 2.04.

It runs stable since more than one year, this is the first time this crash
happened. We restart Tomcat/Apache nightly. The crash happened two seconds after
the event log message that the tomcat service was started.

Does anybody have any idea or has seen this also ? Google does not know the
keywords from the error message.
creator: wknauf@hg-online.de

text: Sorry, no chance. And probably it will never ever happen any more.
creator: wknauf@hg-online.de

text: If you are ever able to reproduce it, please re-open.
creator: markt@apache.org
